conclusion: Apply principles of mechanics: laws of motion and conservation of energy
Problem involves two blocks on an inclined plane, P and Q initially at rest
Collision results in change in velocities; determine final velocities of P and Q
Identify given values: Mass of P = 4m, Mass of Q = m, Inclination angle = θ, Coefficient of kinetic friction = tan θ, Maximum static friction = μg
Q is initially at rest, so its initial velocity v_{Q_{1}} = 0
Apply conservation of momentum: v_{P_{1}} = (5/3) v_{Q_{1}}
Maximum static friction is μg, frictional force F = μmg
Frictional force acts in direction of motion: m * a = μmg, so a = μg
Using v_{P_{1}} = (5/3) v_{Q_{1}} and a = μg, find final velocity of P: v_{P_{1}} = (5/3) v_{Q_{1}} = (5/3) * (v_{Q_{1}}/μg)
